channel.title: Exit node tor. Help
channel.description:
Good afternoon. Tell me please. Customize my output node TOR, but did not get it as a output node in Whonyx.
I edit torrc file and add to:
> ExitNodes ServerName > StrictExitNodes 1
But when i run the Tor, I get errors in the console.
> Type: "whonix" <enter> for help. > + sudo service tor@default restart > Job for tor@default.service failed. See 'systemctl status tor@default.service' and 'journalctl -xn' for details. > + sudo service tor@default status > ● tor@default.service - Anonymizing overlay network for TCP > Loaded: loaded (/lib/systemd/system/tor@default.service; static) > Active: activating (auto-restart) (Result: exit-code) since Sun 2016-06-12 17:43:46 UTC; 27ms ago > Process: 5296 ExecStart=/usr/bin/tor --defaults-torrc /usr/share/tor/tor-service-defaults-torrc -f /etc/tor/torrc --RunAsDaemon 0 (code=exited, status=0/SUCCESS) > Process: 10555 ExecStartPre=/usr/bin/tor --defaults-torrc /usr/share/tor/tor-service-defaults-torrc -f /etc/tor/torrc --RunAsDaemon 0 --verify-config (code=exited, status=1/FAILURE) > Process: 10549 ExecStartPre=/usr/bin/install -Z -m 02750 -o debian-tor -g debian-tor -d /var/run/tor (code=exited, status=0/SUCCESS) > Main PID: 5296 (code=exited, status=0/SUCCESS)
> Jun 12 17:43:46 host systemd[1]: tor@default.service: control process exited, code=exited status=1 > Jun 12 17:43:46 host systemd[1]: Failed to start Anonymizing overlay network for TCP. > Jun 12 17:43:46 host systemd[1]: Unit tor@default.service entered failed state.
How to add exit node?
Sorry for the English, thanks to Google translator!

item.title: Exit node tor. Help
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Also most likely unrelated to Whonix -> https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Support#Free_Support_Principle

Read full topic

item.title: Exit node tor. Help
item.dc:creator: Ego
item.description:
Good day,

Setting a fixed exit node, while beeing possible over torrc, if you somehow got the IP of an exit node, shouldn’t be done. There is no benefit from doing it, however you will decrease your safety by a huge margin. That is why the possibility to do this will likely be patched out of Tor in the future.

Have a nice day,

Ego

Read full topic

item.title: Exit node tor. Help
item.dc:creator: Armus
item.description:
Good afternoon.
Tell me please. Customize my output node TOR, but did not get it as a output node in Whonyx.

I edit torrc file and add to:

ExitNodes ServerName
StrictExitNodes 1

But when i run the Tor, I get errors in the console.

Type: “whonix” for help.

  • sudo service tor@default restart
    Job for tor@default.service failed. See ‘systemctl status tor@default.service’ and ‘journalctl -xn’ for details.
  • sudo service tor@default status
    ● tor@default.service - Anonymizing overlay network for TCP
    Loaded: loaded (/lib/systemd/system/tor@default.service; static)
    Active: activating (auto-restart) (Result: exit-code) since Sun 2016-06-12 17:43:46 UTC; 27ms ago
    Process: 5296 ExecStart=/usr/bin/tor --defaults-torrc /usr/share/tor/tor-service-defaults-torrc -f /etc/tor/torrc --RunAsDaemon 0 (code=exited, status=0/SUCCESS)
    Process: 10555 ExecStartPre=/usr/bin/tor --defaults-torrc /usr/share/tor/tor-service-defaults-torrc -f /etc/tor/torrc --RunAsDaemon 0 --verify-config (code=exited, status=1/FAILURE)
    Process: 10549 ExecStartPre=/usr/bin/install -Z -m 02750 -o debian-tor -g debian-tor -d /var/run/tor (code=exited, status=0/SUCCESS)
    Main PID: 5296 (code=exited, status=0/SUCCESS)

Jun 12 17:43:46 host systemd[1]: tor@default.service: control process exited, code=exited status=1
Jun 12 17:43:46 host systemd[1]: Failed to start Anonymizing overlay network for TCP.
Jun 12 17:43:46 host systemd[1]: Unit tor@default.service entered failed state.

How to add exit node?

Sorry for the English, thanks to Google translator!

Read full topic
